meanings.definition: (adjective) approaching a value or curve arbitrarily closely without actually reaching it
meanings.sent1: The line was asymptotic to the curve, getting closer and closer without touching.
meanings.sent2: The graph showed an asymptotic behavior as it neared the y-axis.
meanings.sent3: The race between the tortoise and the hare was asymptotic, with the tortoise almost catching up at the end.
meanings.sent4: Her progress in learning the new language was asymptotic, always improving but never quite fluent.
meanings.sent5: The relationship between effort and success can be described as asymptotic, with diminishing returns over time.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a manner that approaches a value or curve arbitrarily closely without actually reaching it
meanings.sent1: The function behaved asymptotically as x approached infinity.
meanings.sent2: She ran asymptotically close to the finish line, but never quite crossed it.
meanings.sent3: The cat stalked the mouse asymptotically, always stopping just short of catching it.
meanings.sent4: His patience wore thin asymptotically, reaching a breaking point slowly but surely.
meanings.sent5: The music built up asymptotically to a crescendo, never quite reaching full volume.
